result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin M Casiano-Nazario

records.addlTxt:
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appears as a friend of the court.  Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

For reasons stated on the record, Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Michael Plaisted to represent defendant at the rate of $125 per hour;  Attorney Plaisted present in court and accepted the appointment. 
During the hearing, outbursts by defendant.  Defendant does not want counsel appointed.
Court attempts to hold colloquy with defendant as to proceeding pro se; Court is unable to conduct the colloquy due to defendant's repeated interruptions.  Court advises defendant that he may choose to not engage with Atty. Plaisted but Court wants Atty. Plaisted as a service to the court.

Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Whether defendant is to repay the County to be determined at a future court hearing.

Order Appointing Counsel to be forwarded to the Court for Judge's signature.  Copies to be mailed to the parties.

Clerk:  jms
Deputy clerk in contact with prosecutor.  Case is rescheduled to 10:00 a.m. on September 21, 2022 in Branch 28.
Court is repeatedly receiving duplicate and triplicate copies of the same pro se filings

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario appears in court pro se, in custody.  Doctor John Pankiewicz and Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for competency hearing.  Defendant makes statements as to his name; talking over the Judge.  State does not challenge Dr. John Pankiewicz's report.  Defendant continued to make repeated statements as to his name; talking over the Judge.  Court qualified Dr. John Pankiewicz to testify as an expert in the field of psychology.   Sworn for the State: Dr. John Pankiewicz.  Direct examination.  No cross.  Testimony closed.  Court places concerns on the record.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 28.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Competency hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Room 620SB / 10:22

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
As case was being called on the record, defendant spoke over the clerk.
Parties in court to address doctor's report.
Defendant continued to make repeated statements as to his name; talking over the Judge.  Court was unable to conduct the hearing as to return of doctor's report.

Court orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 28.

Forensics contacted by the deputy clerk during the hearing; Dr. Pankiewicz's availability confirmed as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms

Affidavit of Mailing, UCC Financing Statement Amendment, Private Agreement, Holds Harmless Indemnity Agreement, Security Agreement - received and filed

Duplicate copies of documents received
received and filed.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Letter filed on June 13, 2022 was filed in error.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in court, in custody.  Paul Tiffin, appearing for Michael Jerome Lonski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
As case was being called on the record, outburst by the defendant.
Parties in court to address status of counsel as to this case.
Defendant continued to make repeated statements as to his name; talking over the Judge.  Court was unable to conduct the hearing as to status of counsel.
Court ordered defendant removed from the courtroom.

On Court's own motion, pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order For Competency Examination to be prepared and forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.  Copy to be forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Status Conference.  Defense requested to withdraw as Counsel.  Defendant escorted out of Court due to behavior.  Court grants Defense Motion to withdraw as Counsel.  Case scheduled for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed a letter regarding the defendant.  DK

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense needs offer and requests a status date.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
FOR BRANCH 25.    Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion to Reduce Bail received and filed.  bm

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson; both appear by video.  Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Michael Fedel. Exhibits 1-4 offered by the State and received by the Court. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. State withdrew exhibits 1-4. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 030798,
Payable Number: 996238,
Receipt Number: 22RP012936,
Amount: $20.00
received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Melvin M Casiano-Nazario in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melvin M Casiano-Nazario appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
